Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: guard room

A vast underground chamber carved from stone, retaining parts of the a natural cavern. A grill in the ceiling allows the entrance of some natural light, which, combined with the red-hued flames of the torches adorning the walls, provide enough light to illuminate most of the room. Some half carved pillars melt into the walls for support or decoration, their unfinished crude edges harmonizing with the general atmosphere of lost and unfulfilled glory. The uneven rocky walls sinuously border the area, forming many dark corners which are void of light, and unfold - for those who walk around - dark tunnels, some of which are sealed by doors, and others that end after only a few steps. A remarkable sandstone sphinx is guarding a stone entrance with hints of gold covering it's sandy fur. The chamber is decorated with strange marks in visibly haphazard patterns. Chalk drawn circles and carved runes build patches on the surfaces, some are freshly cleaned and some are covered by their powdery blanket, unaffected by the chill breeze that stirs the ever-flowing dust of the chamber. $(parent-desc)
The guard room is a vast underground cavern with many passages leading to and from here. Chalk drawn and engraved symbols decorate the room and a chill wind stirs up the ever-flowing dust particles.

A vast underground chamber carved from stone, still showing parts of a natural cavern. A grill in the ceiling provides some natural light, supplemented by the light of torches mounted on the uneven sinuous walls. Partly carved pillars and mystical symbols (both engraved and chalk drawn) are scattered around the room. Half hidden tunnels lead to unknown destinations, some are sealed with doors, and a stone entrance is blocked by a magnificent carved sandstone sphinx. $(parent-desc)
http://img9.imageshack.us/img9/259/guardroom.jpg
ornate, brass double doors

This is a large set of looming double doors, carved and manipulates as such that leering skulls peer out from different sections of the doors. The brass is darkened and dulled from the lack of attention, and thus gives the hollows of the skulls more accent.
A large set of double doors set in the eastern wall. Upon the doors, a design has been depicted of leering skulls and bits and pieces of a skeleton.
a slim brass door
A brass door standing in the northern most wall; it is crafted from brass like the one in the east, but this one is relatively plain in comparison.
NEW detail
the high, crumbling ceiling

The high, crumbling ceiling. It is completely uneven with large chunks of stone sticking out of place here and there giving the appearance that it could topple at any moment. It is unsupported save for the bug-laced cobwebs decorating nearly every corner. Crumbling with decay, a large hole has formed in the ceiling that allows light to filter in from above, but to disallow those above from peering in, a bronze grate covers it.

The high, crumbling ceiling. It is completely uneven with large chunks of stone sticking out of place here and there. Bug-laced cobwebs decorate nearly every corner. As if torn from the ceiling, there is a graping hole covered over by a grate to keep those above from seeing in.
the large cobwebs in the corners

{Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built upon the corners formed by the decaying catacomb walls. Some are vacant, their silken strands hanging limp in the lifeless air, others bear {unnaturally large|sinuous|hairy|chitinous} spiders huddled upon their surface, protecting a myriad of spun and captured bugs.
an over-sized cockroach

An over-sized cockroach crouched in the corner. It is three inches long and reddish-brown in color with a yellow border on its pronotum. It is fully winged, and, upon sensing your gaze, it lets out a feral hiss.
An over-sized cockroach crouched in the corner.
the northeast corner
The northeast corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
The northeast corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
the northwest corner
The northwest corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
The northwest corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
the southeast corner
The southeast corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
The southeast corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
the southwest corner
The southwest corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
The southwest corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
the countless corners
The numerous corners formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
The numerous corners formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
a multitude of cracks
A multitude of deep cracks lace the surrounding stone structures, housing a large variety of insects and generally compromising the stability of the area.
A multitude of deep cracks lace the surrounding stone structures.
the endless dust
Endless layers of thick dust collected over time have settled on every visible surface, unhelpfully adding to the already smothering effect of the area.
Endless layers of thick dust have settled on every visible surface.
an egg {case|sack}
An egg sack has been deposited in the corner. It is {black|putrid green} in color and has been glued to its location by a thick, slimy secretion.
An egg sack has been deposited in the corner. It is {black|putrid green} in color and has been glued to its location by a thick, slimy secretion.
a {meaty|fleshy|dry|crumbling|cracked} femur bone

A whole, {meaty|fleshy|dry|crumbling|cracked} femur bone with knuckles on each end is lying on the dust-covered floor. Mounds of unidentifiable insects with prying teeth voraciously cling to its surface.
A whole, {meaty|fleshy|dry|crumbling|cracked} femur bone lying on the dust-covered floor.
the dust-covered stone floor

Beneath the thick coating of dust is a cracked, uneven stone floor. The floor appears to swell as a multitude of indiscernible, sinuous insects skitters in and out of the crevices and over your feet. The light flowing through the grille illuminates sections of the ground giving a new contrast to the mystical chalk-drawn circles haphazardly decorating the floor. Upon closer inspection you note some smaller symbols engraved into the suitably sized stones.
Beneath the thick coating of dust is a cracked, uneven stone floor. Chalk drawn and engraved mystic circles and symbols delight the uniform grayness of the ground.
some crumbling wall fragments
Separating from the decaying walls are crumbling wall fragments. Large hunks of failing, split stone teeter precariously here and there, compromising the security of the area.
Separating from the decaying walls are crumbling wall fragments.
a large, bronze grate
Because of the crumbling, decayed ceiling, this bronze grate was crafted to conceal the occurrences the go on down here. The small holes in the grate allow light to filter in from above.
A bronze grate that has been crafted and shaped to conceal the fissure that has formed in the ceiling, it is rather large.
a {degenerated|decayed|disjointed|aged|dusty|broken} jaw bone

A {degenerated|decayed|disjointed|aged|dusty|broken} jaw bone is hidden amongst the dust on the floor. Upon closer examination, you notice that both the maxilla and mandible are densely covered in bored holes, picked clean of flesh long ago. The joints have been completely severed, making it a fragile structure that could topple and break at any moment.
A {degenerated|decayed|disjointed|aged|dusty|broken}jaw bone is hidden among the dust on the floor.
NEW detail
a {decomposing|decayed|disjointed|aged|dusty|broken} rib cage

A {decomposing|decayed|disjointed|aged|dusty|broken} rib cage jutting out of the dust-covered floor. It appears to have seven pairs of ribs remaining, two sets having been partially eaten away. Thin strands of rotting meat dangle precariously between its spaces, providing a delectable snack for the necrophagous bugs that litter its surface.
A {decomposing|decayed|disjointed|aged|dusty|broken} rib cage jutting out of the dust-covered floor.
{atrophied|old|dusty|cracked|chipped|aged} skull

An {atrophied|old|dusty|cracked|chipped|aged} skull rests lifelessly upon the dust-covered floor. Deep, vacant eye sockets are set above a black hole where the nose once was. The mouth is frozen in a fully-open, terrified expression, as though the victim's last moments were spent screaming madly. Only a few fragments of brittle, cracked teeth remain inside, the rest gone missing.
An {atrophied|old|dusty|cracked|chipped|aged} skull rests lifelessly upon the dust-covered floor.
empty
decorative sandstone sphinx

An impressing block of sandstone carved into the elegant shape of a towering sphinx. The statue poses in a watchful, attentive stance, her paws resting on a scroll with barely visible symbols while her tail snakes around a sword resting under her body. Patches of gold dust still cling to her muscular body.
empty
symbols on the sphinx
The scrolls under the sphinx pawn host a set of old symbols.
tail of the sphinx
eyes of the sphinx
the spiders
Unnaturally large, hairy spiders with glowing red eyes and visible fangs tensely huddle upon the surfaces of some of the impressive cobwebs, guarding a myriad of spun and captured bugs.
Unnaturally large, hairy spiders huddle upon the surfaces of some of the impressive cobwebs, guarding a myriad of spun and captured bugs.
various symbols

Various symbols that speckle the walls and floor of the room joining the fauna of the place in enlivening the humdrum mass of stone. Some simple and shapeless, drawn with a chalk-like material, others more lasting, carved with a painstakingly over-accurate precision, their variety and selection fit to appease the most daring demands. While they do not contain magical energies, they are tools of magic, without question. The arrangement clearly reveals the symbols to be linked to necromancy. They fulfill various roles, be it summoning, binding of black spirits or defenses from white magic, all are here.

Various symbols that speckle the walls and floor of the room joining the fauna of the place in enlivening the humdrum mass of stone. While they do not contain magical energies, they are tools of magic, without question. The arrangement clearly reveals the symbols to be linked to necromancy. They fulfill various roles, be it summoning, binding of black spirits or defenses from white magic, all are here.
the decaying walls to the east

To the east the walls are comprised of heavy, decaying stone slabs laden with cracks. An uneven layer of dust obscures the actual walls, aside from the defined hand prints scattered here and there. Mystic symbols, both drawn with chalk and engraved, alternate the half-built pillars, haphazardly decorating the twists and turns of the serpentine rock, occasionally revealing the tunnels leading away to unknown destinations. The chaotic arrangement is dominated by an ornate brass double door. Even with the strategically positioned torches it is dark, you nevertheless note insects writhing over the surface, as well as the occasional over-sized cockroach.

To the east the walls are comprised of heavy, decaying stone slabs laden with cracks. You can barely discern insect-like bodies crawling along the uneven surface. Mystic symbols drawn with chalk or engraved alternate the half-built pillars haphazardly decorating the rock, hiding many of the tunnels leading from the room. The chaotic arrangement is dominated by an ornate brass double door.
the decaying north wall

The north wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. An uneven layer of dust obscures the actual wall, aside from the defined hand prints scattered here and there. Although it is dark, you nevertheless note insects writhing over the surface, as well as the occasional over-sized cockroach.
The north wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. You can barely discern insect-like bodies crawling along the uneven surface.
the decaying south wall

The south wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. An uneven layer of dust obscures the actual wall, aside from the defined hand prints scattered here and there. Although it is dark, you nevertheless note insects writhing over the surface, as well as the occasional over-sized cockroach.
The south wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. You can barely discern insect-like bodies crawling along the uneven surface.
the decaying west wall

The west wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. An uneven layer of dust obscures the actual wall, aside from the defined hand prints scattered here and there. Although it is dark, you nevertheless note insects writhing over the surface, as well as the occasional over-sized cockroach.
The west wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. You can barely discern insect-like bodies crawling along the uneven surface.
the decaying walls

Some of the walls here are comprised of heavy, decaying stone slabs laden with cracks. An uneven layer of dust obscures the actual walls, aside from the defined hand prints scattered here and there. Other sections retain the original cavern rock with half finished pillars engraved into it next to hard to decrypt mystical symbols marking the surface. Although it is dark, you nevertheless note insects writhing over the surfaces, as well as the occasional over-sized cockroach.

Some of the walls here are comprised of heavy, decaying stone slabs laden with cracks. Other sections keep the original cave like nature with mystical symbols and half finished pillars melting into its uneven surface. You can barely discern insect-like bodies crawling along the uneven surfaces.
